div.l: Thise sely clerkes / rennen vp and doıı̄un
With kepe kepe / stand stand / iosa · warderere
Ga whistle thou / and I shal kepe hym here
But shortly tyl it was verray nyght
They couthe not / though they dide her myght
Her capil cacche / he ranne awey so faste
Til in a diche / they caughte hym atte laste
Wery and weet as bestes ben̄ in the reyn̄
Cometh sely Iohn / and with hym cometh Aleyn̄
¶ Allas qduod Iohn / the day that I was born̄
Now ere we drevyn / tyl hethyng and til scorn̄
Oure corn is stole / men wol vs fooles calle
Bothe the wardeyn̄ / and oure felawes alle
And namely the meller / wele away
Thus playneth Iohn / as he goth by the way
Toward the Melle / and bayhard in his hande
The meller sittynge by the fyre he fonde
For it was nyght / and ferther myght they nought
But for the love of god / they hym bisought
Of herberwe and of ese / as for her peny
The meller seide ageyn̄ / ȝif ther be eny
Swich as it is / ȝit shal ȝe have youre part
Myn̄ hous is streit / and ȝe have lerned art
Ye can by argument make a place
A myle brood / of twenty fote of space
Lat se nowe / ȝif this place may suffice
Or make it rowmer / wᵗith speche as is youre gise
¶ Now Symond seide this Iohn by seint Cuthberd
Ay is thou mery / and that is faire answerd
I have herde say / men sal taken of twa thynges
Swilk as ye fyndes or take swilke as ye brynges
But specialy / I pray the hoost dere
Gete vs some mete and drynke and make vs chere
And we wol paie trewely atte fulle
With empty handes / men may nane haukes tulle
Lo here oure syluer redy forto spende
This Meller to the toıı̄un his doughter sende
For ale and breed / and rosted hem a goos
